translation: He replied, "No!"

translation: "Why is that?

source_sentence: 世間現有五色，青、黃、赤、白，麤、細、長、短，日、月、星象、山陵、溝壑，而彼言無。
translation: There are five existing colors in the world: blue, yellow, red, and white, coarse, fine, long, and short, sun, moon, stars, mountains, and ravines, but they say they're nonexistent.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝亦如是。
translation: You too are like that.

translation: The life span of the Heaven of the Thirty-three is really existent and not false, but since you haven't seen it yourself, you say it's nonexistent."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「汝雖言有，我猶不信。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, "Even though you say it exists, I still don't believe it."

source_sentence: 迦葉又言：「汝復作何緣，而知其無？」
translation: Kāśyapa also said, "By what other reason do you know it's nonexistent?"

translation: They replied, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我所封村人有作賊者，伺察所得，將詣我所，語我言：『此人為賊，唯願治之。』
translation: A thief from the village I've sealed off visited me and said, 'This man is a thief; please treat him.'

source_sentence: 我答言：『收縛此人，著大釜中，韋葢厚泥，使其牢密，勿令有泄，遣人圍遶，以火煮之。』
translation: I answered, 'Bind this man, put him in a large cauldron, cover him with thick mud, make it secure, and prevent any leakage, surround him with people, and boil him in the fire.'

source_sentence: 我時欲觀知其精神所出之處，將諸侍從，遶釜而觀，都不見其神去來處，又發釜看，亦不見神有往來之處。
translation: Desiring to observe where his spirit was leaving, I gathered my attendants around the cauldron and observed them, but they couldn't see where the spirit had gone or come from.

source_sentence: 以此緣故，知無他世。」
translation: For this reason, I knew there was no other world."

translation: Kāśyapa also said, "Now, I'll ask you this question, and if you can answer it, I'll give you as many rewards as I like.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝在高樓，息寢臥時，頗曾夢見山林、江河、園觀、浴池、國邑、街巷不？」
translation: When you were up in that high building, did you ever dream of mountains, rivers, gardens, mansions, baths, countries, or streets while you were sleeping?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「夢見！」
translation: replied, "I dreamt it!"

source_sentence: 又問：「婆羅門！
translation: And he asked, "Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝當夢時，居家眷屬侍衛汝不？」
translation: When you dream, will the members of your household guard you?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「侍衛！」
translation: He replied, "Guard!"

source_sentence: 又問：「婆羅門！
translation: And he asked, "Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝諸眷屬見汝識神有出入不？」
translation: Do your followers see a difference between your consciousness and your spirit?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「不見！」
translation: replied, "I don't see it!"

source_sentence: 迦葉又言：「汝今生存，識神出入，尚不可見，況於死者乎？
translation: Kāśyapa also said, "Now that you're alive, your consciousness and spirit can't even be seen coming and going, so why wouldn't they be able to see the dead?

source_sentence: 汝不可以目前現事觀於眾生。
translation: You can't look at sentient beings in the present.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有比丘初夜、後夜捐除睡眠，精勤不懈，專念道品，以三昧力，修淨天眼；以天眼力，觀於眾生。
translation: "Suppose there's a monk who rids himself of drowsiness in the early and latter portions of the night, diligently and tirelessly concentrates on the factors of the path, cultivates the pure divine eye with the power of samādhi, and observes sentient beings with the power of the divine eye.

source_sentence: 死此生彼，從彼生此，壽命長短，顏色好醜，隨行受報，善惡之趣，皆悉知見。
translation: He sees them all when they die here and are born there, and he sees them all when he's born here, their length of life, their good and bad appearance, the consequences of their actions, and the destinies of good and evil.

source_sentence: 汝不可以穢濁肉眼，不能徹見眾生所趣，便言無也。
translation: You mustn't defile the physical eye and say 'nothing' simply because you can't see thoroughly the destinies of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 以此可知，必有他世。」
translation: From this, it's clear that there must be another life."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「汝雖引喻說有他世，如我所見，猶無有也。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, "Even though you cite this metaphor to say that there are other worlds, as I've seen it, there still aren't any."

source_sentence: 迦葉又言：「汝頗更有因緣，知無他世耶？」
translation: Kāśyapa also said, "Do you have another reason to know that there's no other world?"

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「有！」
translation: The brāhmaṇas said, "Yes!"

source_sentence: 迦葉言：「以何緣知？」
translation: Kāśyapa said, "By what means do we know?"

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「我所封村人有作賊者，伺察所得，將詣我所，語我言：『此人為賊，唯願治之。』
translation: The brāhmaṇas said, "A thief from my village came to me after surveying him and told me, 'This person is a thief; please treat him.'

source_sentence: 我勅左右收縛此人，生剝其皮，求其識神，而都不見；又勅左右臠割其肉，以求識神，又復不見；又勅左右截其筋、脉、骨間求神，又復不見；又勅左右打骨出髓，髓中求神，又復不見。
translation: I commanded my men to bind him, strip his skin, and search for his consciousness, but they didn't see him; I also commanded my men to cut his flesh to search for his consciousness, but they didn't see him again; I commanded my men to cut his tendons, veins, and bones to search for his consciousness, but they didn't see him again; I also commanded my men to strike his bones to get out his marrow and search for his consciousness in his marrow, but they didn't see him again.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我以此緣，知無他世。」
translation: By this condition, I know there's no other world."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「諸有智者，以譬喻得解，我今復當為汝引喻。
translation: Kāśyapa then said, "Those of you who are wise and have understood by parables, I will again draw parables for you.

source_sentence: 乃往過去久遠世時，有一國壞，荒毀未復，時，有商賈五百乘車經過其土，有一梵志奉事火神，常止一林。
translation: Once upon a time in a distant past, there was a country that had been destroyed and lay waste before it recovered, and there were five hundred merchants riding in chariots that passed through that land.

source_sentence: 時，諸商人皆往投宿，清旦別去，時，事火梵志作是念言：『向諸商人宿此林中，今者已去，儻有遺漏可試往看。』
translation: The merchants all went to stay there, and at sunrise they departed. The priest serving the fire then had this thought, 'The merchants stayed here in the forest, but now that they've left, if there's anything missing, try looking at it.'

source_sentence: 尋詣彼所，都無所見，唯有一小兒始年一歲，獨在彼坐。
translation: When he looked there, he saw nothing, except a little boy who was a year old and sitting alone.

source_sentence: 梵志復念：『我今何忍見此小兒於我前死？
translation: The priest then thought, 'How could I bear to see this little boy die in front of me?'

source_sentence: 今者寧可將此小兒至吾所止，養活之耶！』
translation: Now, how could we not have brought this little boy to our house and kept him alive?'

source_sentence: 即抱小兒往所住處而養育之，其兒轉大，至十餘歲。
translation: He took the little boy and raised him where he was staying, and he grew older, reaching more than ten years old.

source_sentence: 「時，此梵志以少因緣欲遊人間，語小兒曰：『我有少緣，欲暫出行，汝善守護此火，慎勿使滅。
translation: "At the time, this priest wanted to travel among people for a few reasons, and he said to the boy, 'For a few reasons, I want to travel for a while; guard this fire well, and be careful not to let it go out.

source_sentence: 若火滅者，當以鑽鑽木，取火燃之。』
translation: If the fire goes out, you'll drill a log with a drill and get it to burn.'

source_sentence: 具誡勅已，出林遊行。
translation: After he had given his instructions, he left the forest and marched out.

source_sentence: 梵志去後，小兒貪戲，不數視火，火遂便滅；小兒戲還，見火已滅，懊惱而言：『我所為非，我父去時，具約勅我，守護此火，慎勿令滅，而我貪戲，致使火滅，當如之何？』
translation: After the priest left, a young boy got into a playful mood and didn't often look at the fire, which then went out. When the boy returned from his play, he saw that the fire had gone out and was upset, saying, 'What I did was wrong. When my father left, he specifically told me to guard this fire and be careful not to let it go out, but I got into a playful mood and caused it to go out.

source_sentence: 彼時，小兒吹灰求火，不能得已，便以斧劈薪求火，復不能得，又復斬薪置於臼中，搗以求火，又不能得。
translation: After blowing ashes to find fire, the boy then chopped wood with an ax to find fire, but again he couldn't get it.

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵志於人間還，詣彼林所，問小兒曰：『吾先勅汝使守護火，火不滅耶？』
translation: "After that, the priest returned from among the people and went to that forest and asked the boy, 'Did I tell you to guard the fire, but it won't go out?'

source_sentence: 小兒對曰：『我向出戲，不時護視，火今已滅。』
translation: The boy replied, 'I used to go out to play and guard myself from time to time, but now the fire has gone out.'

source_sentence: 復問小兒：『汝以何方便更求火耶？』
translation: Again, he asked the boy, 'What method did you use to seek fire again?'

source_sentence: 小兒報曰：『火出於木，我以斧破木求火，不得火；復斬之令碎，置於臼中，杵搗求火，復不能得。』
translation: The boy reported, 'Fire comes from wood; I chopped it with an ax to get it, but I couldn't get it; I chopped it up again, put it in a mortar, and pounded it for fire, but I couldn't get it again.'

source_sentence: 時，彼梵志以鑽鑽木出火，積薪而燃，告小兒曰：『夫欲求火，法應如此，不應破析杵碎而求。』
translation: That priest then drilled the wood to get the fire, piled up the wood and set it on fire, and told the boy, 'This is the way to seek fire, not by chopping it down and pounding it with a mortar.'

source_sentence: 「婆羅門！
translation: "Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝亦如是無有方便，皮剝死人而求識神，汝不可以目前現事觀於眾生。
translation: In the same way, you have no skill in skinning a dead person and seeking the spirit of consciousness, and you can't look at sentient beings in their present condition.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 有比丘初夜後夜捐除睡眠，精勤不懈，專念道品，以三昧力，修淨天眼，以天眼力，觀於眾生，死此生彼，從彼生此，壽命長短，顏色好醜，隨行受報，善惡之趣，皆悉知見；汝不可以穢濁肉眼，不能徹見眾生所趣，便言無也。
translation: "Suppose there's a monk who rids himself of drowsiness first and last night, diligently and tirelessly concentrates on the factors of the path, cultivates the pure divine eye with the power of samādhi, and observes with the power of the divine eye that all sentient beings are born here or here after death, have long and short lives, are good and ugly in color, are rewarded according to their actions, and are destined for good and evil; you mustn't defile the physical eye and say 'none' when it's unable to thoroughly see the destinies of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 以此可知，必有他世。」
translation: From this, it's clear that there must be another life."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「汝雖引喻說有他世，如我所見，猶無有也。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, "Even though you cite this metaphor to say that there are other worlds, as I've seen it, there still aren't any."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「汝頗更有因緣，知無他世耶？」
translation: Kāśyapa again said, "Do you have another reason to know that there's no other world?"

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「有！」
translation: The brāhmaṇas said, "Yes!"

source_sentence: 迦葉言：「以何緣知？」
translation: Kāśyapa said, "By what means do we know?"

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「我所封村人有作賊者，伺察所得，將詣我所，語我言：『此人為賊，唯願治之。』
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "A man from my village who's been banned as a thief and who's been surveilled will come to me and tell me, 'This man is a thief; please treat him.'

source_sentence: 我勅左右：『將此人以稱稱之。』
translation: I commanded my attendants, 'Give this person a title.'

source_sentence: 侍者受命，即以稱稱。
translation: The attendant did as ordered, and he gave him a title.

source_sentence: 又告侍者：『汝將此人安徐殺之，勿損皮肉。』
translation: He also told the attendant, 'Kill this man quietly and slowly, without harming his skin or flesh.'

source_sentence: 即受我教，殺之無損。
translation: He then did as I instructed, and he killed him without harming him.

source_sentence: 我復勅左右：『更重稱之。』
translation: I then commanded my attendant, 'Weigh him again.'

source_sentence: 乃重於本。
translation: They then reverted to the original.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 生稱彼人，識神猶在，顏色悅豫，猶能言語，其身乃輕；死已重稱，識神已滅，無有顏色，不能語言，其身更重，我以此緣，知無他世。」
translation: When someone is born, they're still called that person, their consciousness and spirit are still present, their color is pleasing, and they can still speak, so their body is light; when they're re re-claimed after death, their consciousness and spirit have ceased, they have no color, they can't speak, and their body is even heavier; by this I know there's no other world."

source_sentence: 迦葉語婆羅門：「吾今問汝，隨意答我。
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Brāhmaṇa, "Now, I've asked you this question, so answer me as you like.

source_sentence: 如人稱鐵，先冷稱已，然後熱稱，何有光色柔輭而輕？
translation: Like a person who weighs iron, how could it have a shiny, flexible, or light color after it's first been weighed cold and then weighed hot?

source_sentence: 何無光色堅[革*卬]而重？」
translation: Why is there no radiant color that's firm [leather*ang] and heavy?"

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「熱鐵有色，柔輭而輕，冷鐵無色，剛強而重。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇas said, "A hot iron is colored, tender, and light, while a cold iron is colorless, rigid, and heavy."

source_sentence: 迦葉語言：「人亦如是，生有顏色，柔輭而輕；死無顏色，剛強而重。
translation: Kāśyapa said, "So it is with people, who are born with color, which is gentle and light, and die without color, which is strong and heavy.

source_sentence: 以此可知，必有他世。」
translation: From this, you can see that there must be another life."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「汝雖引喻說有他世，如我所見，必無有也。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, "Even though you cite this metaphor to say there's another life, as I've seen it, there must be none."

source_sentence: 迦葉言：「汝復有何緣，知無他世？」
translation: Kāśyapa said, "What other condition do you have for knowing there's no other world?"

source_sentence: 婆羅門答言：「我有親族，遇患篤重。
translation: The brāhmaṇa replied, "I have a family member who's in serious trouble.

source_sentence: 時，我到彼語言：『扶此病人，令右脇臥。』
translation: When I arrived, I said, 'Help this patient and make him lie on his right side.'

source_sentence: 視瞻、屈伸、言語如常；又使左臥，反覆宛轉，屈伸、視瞻、言語如常，尋即命終。
translation: He looked, stretched, and spoke as usual; then he made his left side lie down, repeatedly moved around, flexed and stretched, looked and stretched, and spoke as usual, and then he was found dead.

source_sentence: 吾復使人扶轉，左臥右臥，反覆諦觀，不復屈伸、視瞻、言語，吾以是知，必無他世。」
translation: I'll then have someone help me around, lay down on my left side or on my right side, and I'll repeatedly examine it, not flexing or stretching, looking or stretching, or speaking as usual; I thus know that there will be no other world."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「諸有智者，以譬喻得解，今當為汝引喻。
translation: Kāśyapa then said, "Those of you who are wise have understood it by parable, so I will draw an example for you now.

source_sentence: 昔有一國不聞貝聲，時，有一人善能吹貝，往到彼國，入一村中，執貝三吹，然後置地。
translation: There was once a country that didn't hear the sound of shells. Then, a man who was skilled at blowing shells went to that country, entered a village, took a shell and blew it three times, then put it on the ground.

source_sentence: 時，村人男女聞聲驚動，皆就往問：『此是何聲，哀和清徹乃如是耶？』
translation: When the village people, both men and women, were startled by the sound, and they all went over to him and asked, 'What is this sound that's so sad and clear?'

source_sentence: 彼人指貝曰：『此物聲也。』
translation: That man pointed to the conch and said, 'This thing makes noise.'

source_sentence: 時，彼村人以手觸貝曰：『汝可作聲！
translation: Then, that villager touched the shell with his hand and said, 'You can make a noise!'

source_sentence: 汝可作聲！』
translation: You may make a noise!'

source_sentence: 貝都不鳴，其主即取貝三吹置地。
translation: When the shells didn't ring, their owner took them and blew them three times onto the ground.

source_sentence: 時，村人言：『向者，美聲非是貝力，有手有口，有氣吹之，然後乃鳴。』
translation: The villagers then said, 'Xiang, that beautiful sound isn't the shell's strength; it's having hands and mouth and breath blowing on it, and then it will sound.'

source_sentence: 人亦如是，有壽有識，有息出入，則能屈伸、視瞻、語言；無壽無識，無出入息，則無屈伸、視瞻、語言。」
translation: So it is with people who have longevity, consciousness, and breath coming and going, then they can bend and stretch, look and look, and speak; without longevity or consciousness and without breath coming and going, there's no bending and stretching, looking and looking, or speaking."

source_sentence: 又語婆羅門：「汝今宜捨此惡邪見，勿為長夜自增苦惱。」
translation: He also told the brāhmaṇa, "Now, it's better for you to abandon this bad, mistaken view and not add to your own suffering for a long time."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「我不能捨，所以然者？
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "I can't abandon it, is that why?

source_sentence: 我自生來長夜諷誦，翫習堅固，何可捨耶？」
translation: I've chanted it long and hard since I was born, so how could I abandon it?"

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「諸有智者，以譬喻得解，我今當更為汝引喻。
translation: Kāśyapa then said, "There are wise people who have understood by parable, so now I will draw further parables for you.

source_sentence: 乃往久遠有一國土，其土邊壃，人民荒壞。
translation: It was a long time ago that there was a land whose boundaries were wide and whose people were desolate.

source_sentence: 彼國有二人，一智一愚，自相謂言：『我是汝親，共汝出城，採侶求財。』
translation: In that land, there were two people, one wise and the other foolish, who said to each other, 'I'm your relative, and I've left the city with you to gather companions and seek property.'

source_sentence: 即尋相隨，詣一空聚，見地有麻即語愚者：『共取持歸。』
translation: They then sought to follow each other and went to an empty village. Seeing hemp on the ground, they said to the foolish man, 'Let's take it together and carry it back to the village.'

source_sentence: 時，彼二人各取一擔，復過前村，見有麻縷，其一智者言：『麻縷成功，輕細可取。』
translation: When they each took a load, they went back through the village and saw some wool, and one of them, the wise man, said, 'The wool is perfectly fine and easy to carry.'

source_sentence: 其一人言：『我已取麻，繫縛牢固，不能捨也。』
translation: The other man said, 'I've taken the hemp, and it's securely bound; I can't let it go.'

source_sentence: 其一智者即取麻縷，重擔而去；復共前進，見有麻布，其一智者言：『麻布成功，輕細可取。』
translation: That other wise man then took the tacks, heaved them up, and departed. Again, they both went forward and saw some linen, and that other wise man said, 'The linen is perfectly fine and desirable.'

source_sentence: 彼一人言：『我以取麻，繫縛牢固，不能復捨。』
translation: One of them said, 'I took the hemp and bound it securely, so I can't let it go again.'

source_sentence: 其一智者即捨麻縷取布自重；復共前行，見有劫貝，其一智者言：『劫貝價貴，輕細可取。』
translation: That other wise man then discarded the hemp wool and took the cloth for his own weight. Again, they both went forward and saw a pearl, and that other wise man said, 'That pearl is too valuable to be taken lightly.'

source_sentence: 彼一人言：『我已取麻，繫縛牢固，齎來道遠，不能捨也。』
translation: One of them said, 'I've taken the hemp, and it's securely bound; it's too far away to carry on the journey, so I can't leave it behind.'

source_sentence: 時，一智者即捨麻布而取劫貝。
translation: That wise man then discarded the linen and took the kalpa shells.

source_sentence: 「如是前行，見劫貝縷，次見白疊，次見白銅，次見白銀，次見黃金，其一智者言：『若無金者，當取白銀，若無白銀，當取白銅，乃至麻縷，若無麻縷，當取麻耳。
translation: "Going along in this way, he saw the thread of the karp, then he saw the white wool, then he saw the white brass, then he saw the white silver, and then he saw the gold. One of the wise men said, 'If there's no gold, you must take the white silver; if there's no white silver, you must take the white brass; even the thread of hemp; if there's no thread of hemp, you must take the hemp ear.'

source_sentence: 今者此村大有黃金，眾寶之上，汝宜捨麻，我當捨銀，共取黃金，自重而歸。』
translation: Now, there's a great deal of gold in this village that's above all other treasures; you should leave the hemp, and I will leave the silver and take the gold together, weighing it myself and returning it.'

source_sentence: 彼一人言：『我取此麻，繫縛牢固，齎來道遠，不能捨也。
translation: One of them said, 'I took this hemp, and it's securely bound; it's a long way from here, so I can't leave it behind.

source_sentence: 汝欲取者，自隨汝意。』
translation: If you want to take it, do as you wish.'

source_sentence: 其一智者捨銀取金，重擔而歸其家，親族遙見彼人大得金寶，歡喜奉迎。
translation: That wise man discarded the silver and took the gold, carrying it heavily and returning it to his family, whose relatives saw from afar that he had won gold and treasure and welcomed him joyfully.

source_sentence: 時，得金者見親族迎，復大歡喜。
translation: When the person who had won the gold saw his relatives greet him, they were again overjoyed.

source_sentence: 其無智人負麻而歸居家，親族見之，不悅亦不起迎，其負麻者倍增憂愧。
translation: When the unwise man carrying hemp returns home, his relatives don't rejoice when they see him, and they don't rise to greet him, making the man carrying hemp doubly sad.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝今宜捨惡習邪見，勿為長夜自增苦惱，如負麻人執意堅固，不取金寶，負麻而歸，空自疲勞，親族不悅，長夜貧窮，自增憂苦也。」
translation: Now, it's better for you to abandon bad habits and wrong views, so you don't add to your own suffering and distress over the long haul. Like the linen bearer who clings to a resolute attitude and doesn't take gold or treasure, he carries the linen and returns, becoming exhausted in vain, displeased with his family, poor over the long haul, and adding to his own misery and suffering."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「我終不能捨此見也，所以者何？
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "I'll never be able to abandon this view, so why is that?

source_sentence: 我以此見多所教授，多所饒益，四方諸王皆聞我名，亦盡知我是斷滅學者。」
translation: Because of this vision, I've taught so much and given so much benefit, the kings in the four directions have heard my name and all know that I'm a scholar of cessation."

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「諸有智者，以譬喻得解，我今當更為汝引喻。
translation: Kāśyapa then said, "Those of you who are wise have understood by parable, so now I will draw another parable for you.

source_sentence: 乃往久遠有一國土，其土邊壃，人民荒壞。
translation: It was a long time ago that there was a land whose boundaries were wide and whose people were desolate.

source_sentence: 時，有商人，有千乘車，經過其土，水穀、薪草不自供足，時商主念言：『我等伴多，水穀、薪草不自供足，今者寧可分為二分，其一分者於前發引。』
translation: When a merchant with a thousand chariots passed through that land and there was not enough water or firewood for them, the merchant owner thought, 'Since we have so many companions and there's not enough water or firewood for them, we might divide them into two parts and guide the former leader with the other part.'

source_sentence: 其前發導師見有一人，身體麤大，目赤面黑，泥塗其身，遙見遠來，即問：『汝從何來？』
translation: The former sponsor then saw a man with a large, coarse body, red eyes and a black face, and a body smeared with mud, and he saw him coming from afar and asked, 'Where did you come from?'

source_sentence: 報言：『我從前村來。』
translation: They replied, 'I've come from the village before.'

source_sentence: 又問彼言：『汝所來處，多有水穀、薪草不耶？』
translation: Again, he asked them, 'Where you came from, is there much water, grain, and firewood?'

source_sentence: 其人報言：『我所來處，豐有水穀，薪草無乏，我於中路逢天暴雨，其處多水，亦豐薪草。』
translation: That man reported, 'Where I've come from, there's an abundance of water and grain, and there's no lack of wood and grass; when there's a rainstorm in the middle of the road, there's plenty of water there, and there's an abundance of wood and grass.'

source_sentence: 又語商主：『汝曹車上若有穀草，盡可捐棄，彼自豐有，不須重車。』
translation: He also said to the merchant, 'If there's any grain or hay on your cart, you can throw it away; it's abundant there, so you don't need to reload the cart.'

source_sentence: 「時，彼商主語眾商言：『吾向前行，見有一人，目赤面黑，泥塗其身，我遙問言：「汝從何來？」
translation: "The merchant then said to the merchants, 'As I was going along, I saw a man with red eyes and a black face, and his body was smeared with mud, and I asked him from a distance, 'Where did you come from?'"

source_sentence: 即答我言：「我從前村來。」
translation: He answered me, "I've come from the village before."

source_sentence: 我尋復問：「汝所來處，豐有水穀、薪草不也？」
translation: I then asked, "Where did you come from, was there plenty of water and grain and firewood?"

source_sentence: 答我言：「彼大豐耳。」
translation: He answered me, "It's very abundant."

source_sentence: 又語我言：「向於中路，逢天暴雨，此處多水，又豐薪草。」
translation: He also said to me, "In the middle of the road, when there's a heavy rain, there's plenty of water here, and it's rich in fuel and hay."

source_sentence: 復語我言：「君等車上若有穀草，盡可捐棄，彼自豐有，不須重車。」
translation: Again, he said to me, "If there's any hay on your chariot, you can throw it away; it's plentiful there, so you don't need to put a heavy cart on it."

source_sentence: 汝等宜各棄諸穀草，輕車速進。』
translation: It's better for each of you to discard the hay and grass, and move quickly on a light chariot.'

source_sentence: 即如其言，各共捐棄穀草，輕車速進。
translation: Just as he said, each of you discarded the hay, and the chariot moved along quickly.

source_sentence: 「如是一日不見水草，二日、三日，乃至七日，又復不見。
translation: "One day they didn't see any hay, and on two, three, or even seven days, they didn't see any again.

source_sentence: 時，商人窮於曠澤，為鬼所食。
translation: The merchant then became destitute in a vast swamp and was eaten by a ghost.

source_sentence: 其後一部，次復進路，商主時前復見一人，目赤面黑，泥塗其身，遙見問言：『汝從何來？』
translation: When the next part of the journey resumed, the merchant again saw a man with red eyes and a black face, his body smeared with mud, and he looked into the distance and asked, 'Where did you come from?'

source_sentence: 彼人答言：『從前村來。』
translation: The man answered, 'I came from the village before you.'

source_sentence: 又問：『汝所來處，豐有水穀、薪草不耶？』
translation: He also asked, 'Where you came from, was there plenty of water and grain and firewood?'

source_sentence: 彼人答曰：『大豐有耳。』
translation: The man answered, 'There's a great abundance of it.'

source_sentence: 又語商主：『吾於中路，逢天暴雨，其處多水，亦豐薪草。』
translation: He also said to the merchant, 'I was in the middle of a road when it rained heavily, and there was plenty of water there, but there was also an abundance of wood and grass.'

source_sentence: 又語商主：『君等車上若有穀草，便可捐棄，彼自豐有，不須重車。』
translation: He also said to the merchant, 'If there's any hay on your chariot, you can throw it away; it's plentiful there, so you don't need to reload your chariot.'

source_sentence: 「時，商主還語諸商人言：『吾向前行，見有一人，道如此事：君等車上若有穀草，可盡捐棄，彼自豐有，不須重車。』
translation: "The merchant then also said to the merchants, 'As I was going along, I saw a man who said this, 'If there's grain and grass on your chariot, you can throw it away; it's in abundance there, so you don't need to reload the chariot.'

source_sentence: 時，商主言：『汝等穀草慎勿捐棄，須得新者然後當棄，所以者何？
translation: The merchant then said, 'Don't throw away the hay; you must get new hay before you throw it away.

source_sentence: 新陳相接，然後當得度此曠野。』
translation: New evidence will be added to it, and then he'll be able to cross this wilderness.'

source_sentence: 時，彼商人重車而行，如是一日不見水草，二日、三日至于七日，又亦不見。
translation: That merchant then travels in a heavy chariot, not seeing any water or grass for a day, nor for two, three, or seven days.

source_sentence: 但見前人為鬼所食，骸骨狼藉。
translation: They only saw the remains of their predecessors, which had been eaten by ghosts, in a disheveled state.

source_sentence: 「婆羅門！
translation: "Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 彼赤眼黑面者，是羅剎鬼也。
translation: "That red-eyed, black-faced one is a Rāṣṭrapāla demon.

source_sentence: 諸有隨汝教者，長夜受苦，亦當如彼。
translation: All those who follow your teaching will suffer for a long time, and they will be like that.

source_sentence: 前部商人無智慧故，隨導師語，自沒其身。
translation: Because the former merchants lacked wisdom, they followed the teacher's words and destroyed their own bodies.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 諸有沙門、婆羅門，精進智慧，有所言說，承用其教者，則長夜獲安，如彼後部商人有智慧故，得免危難。
translation: "If there are ascetics or priests who are diligent and wise, who speak their minds, and who accept their teaching, then they will attain peace for a long time, just as those latter merchants who have wisdom are spared danger.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇas!

source_sentence: 汝今寧可捨此惡見，勿為長夜自增苦惱。」
translation: Now, you might as well abandon this bad view and not add to your own suffering for a long time."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「我終不能捨所見也，設有人來強諫我者，生我忿耳，終不捨見。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, "I'll never be able to abandon what I see, and if someone comes and forcefully remonstrates with me, it will give rise to my anger, and I'll never abandon that view."

source_sentence: 迦葉又言：「諸有智者，以譬喻得解，我今當復為汝引喻。
translation: Kāśyapa also said, "Those of you who are wise have understood by parable, so now I will again draw parables for you.

source_sentence: 乃昔久遠有一國土，其土邊壃，人民荒壞。
translation: Once upon a time, there was a land whose boundaries were wide and whose people were desolate.

source_sentence: 時，有一人好喜養猪，詣他空村，見有乾糞，尋自念言：『此處饒糞，我猪豚飢，今當取草裹此乾糞，頭戴而歸。』
translation: When a man who liked to raise pigs visited an empty village and saw dried dung, he looked for himself and said, 'This place is rich in dung, and my pigs are starving; now I'll wrap this dried dung in grass, put it on my head, and return.'

source_sentence: 即尋取草，裹糞而戴，於其中路，逢天大雨，糞汁流下，至于足跟，眾人見已，皆言：『狂人！
translation: He then went and got some straw, wrapped it around the dung, and put it on. When it rained heavily in the middle of the road, the dung flowed down to his heels.

source_sentence: 糞除臭處，正使天晴，尚不應戴，況於雨中戴之而行！』
translation: When it is sunny, you shouldn't wear it, let alone when it's raining!

source_sentence: 其人方怒，逆罵詈言：『汝等自癡，不知我家猪豚飢餓；汝若知者，不言我癡。』
translation: When they became angry, they rebuked and insulted him, saying, 'You're deluded, for you don't know that my family is starving for pigs and ducks; if you knew that, you wouldn't say I'm deluded.'

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝今寧可捨此惡見，勿守迷惑，長夜受苦。
translation: Now, you might better abandon this bad view and not remain deluded, suffering long into the night.

source_sentence: 如彼癡子戴糞而行，眾人訶諫，逆更瞋罵，謂他不知。」
translation: It's like that foolish son who walks around wearing dung, and when people rebuke him, they rebel against him and insult him, saying that he doesn't know."

source_sentence: 婆羅門語迦葉言：「汝等若謂行善生天，死勝生者，汝等則當以刀自刎，飲毒而死，或五縛其身，自投高岸，而今貪生不能自殺者，則知死不勝生。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said to Kāśyapa, "If you had thought that good actions would lead to birth in heaven and that death would be preferable to birth, you would have killed yourself with a sword, drank poison, or tied yourself to five fetters and thrown yourself onto a high shore.

source_sentence: 迦葉復言：「諸有智者，以譬喻得解，我今當更為汝引喻。
translation: Kāśyapa then said, "Those of you who are wise have understood by parable, so now I will draw another parable for you.

source_sentence: 昔者，此斯波醯村有一梵志，耆舊長宿，年百二十。
translation: Once, there was a priest in this village of Sīpaṃkhye who was a veteran and had stayed there for 120 years.

source_sentence: 彼有二妻，一先有子，一始有娠。
translation: He had two wives, one who first had a child and one who was pregnant.

source_sentence: 時，彼梵志未久命終，其大母子語小母言：『所有財寶，盡應與我，汝無分也。』
translation: When that priest hadn't long since reached the end of his life, his older mother said to his younger mother, 'All the wealth and treasure you have should be given to me; you have no part in it.'

source_sentence: 時小母言：『汝為小待，須我分娠，若生男者，應有財分；若生女者，汝自嫁娶，當得財物。』
translation: The younger mother then said, 'You're a young woman who needs a share of my pregnancy; if a boy is born, you should have a share of the wealth; if a girl is born, you should marry her yourself, and she will get the wealth.'

source_sentence: 彼子慇懃再三索財，小母答如初；其子又逼不已，時，彼小母即以利刀自決其腹，知為男女。」
translation: When the son repeatedly asked for money, the young mother answered as before; when the son refused to stop pressuring her, the young mother then cut her own belly with a sharp knife and knew it was a man or a woman."

source_sentence: 語婆羅門言：「母今自殺，復害胎子，汝婆羅門，亦復如是；既自殺身，復欲殺人。
translation: He said to the brāhmaṇa, "Now that the mother has killed herself and is again harming her unborn child, you brāhmaṇas will likewise; having killed yourself, you'll want to kill others.

source_sentence: 若沙門、婆羅門，精勤修善，戒德具足，久存世者，多所饒益，天人獲安。
translation: If ascetics and priests diligently cultivate goodness and the virtue of morality, their long lives in the world will be abundantly beneficial and will bring peace to gods and humans.

source_sentence: 吾今末後為汝引喻，當使汝知惡見之殃。
translation: Now, I'll draw an example for you in the future, so you'll know the consequences of bad views.

source_sentence: 昔者，此斯波醯村有二伎人，善於弄丸，二人角伎，一人得勝。
translation: Once upon a time, there were two players in this village of Spoheme who were skilled at fiddling with balls, and one of them won a contest.

source_sentence: 時，不如者語勝者言：『今日且停，明當更共試。』
translation: The one who didn't win said to the winner, 'Stop today, and we'll try again tomorrow.'

source_sentence: 其不如者即歸家中，取其戱丸，塗以毒藥，暴之使乾，明持此丸詣勝者所，語言：『更可角伎。』
translation: The not-good then went home, took their drama ball, smeared it with poison, dried it up, and brought it to the victor's place in the morning, saying, 'We can try it again.'

source_sentence: 即前共戱，先以毒丸授彼勝者：『勝者即吞。』
translation: They then shared the drama, and first they gave the ball of poison to the victor, saying, 'The victor will swallow it.'

source_sentence: 其不如者復授毒丸，得已隨吞，其毒轉行，舉身戰動。
translation: The not-good then gives him the poison pill again, swallows it as he gets it, and the poison travels away, lifting his body in battle.

source_sentence: 時，不如者以偈罵曰：「『吾以藥塗丸，　　而汝吞不覺；　　小伎汝為吞，　　久後自當知。』」
translation: The not-good then rebuked him in verse, saying, 'I've rubbed a pill with medicine, but you swallowed it without realizing it; you'll know it yourself after a while if you swallow a small trick.'

source_sentence: 迦葉語婆羅門言：「汝今當速捨此惡見，勿為專迷，自增苦毒，如彼伎人，吞毒不覺。」
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Brāhmaṇa, "Now, you must quickly abandon this bad view and not become obsessed with it, which will add to your own suffering and poison, like that trickset man who swallows poison and doesn't realize it."

source_sentence: 時，婆羅門白迦葉言：「尊者初設月喻，我時已解，所以往返，不時受者，欲見迦葉辯才智慧，生牢固信耳。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then said to Kāśyapa, "Venerable, I've understood the moon metaphor when it was first proposed, so I go back and forth and accept it from time to time because I want to see Kāśyapa's eloquence and wisdom and develop a firm faith in it.

source_sentence: 我今信受，歸依迦葉。」
translation: I now believe and accept it, and I take refuge in Kāśyapa."

source_sentence: 迦葉報言：「汝勿歸我，如我所歸無上尊者，汝當歸依。」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, "Don't take refuge in me; take refuge in the unsurpassed honored one as I take refuge in you."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「不審所歸無上尊者，今為所在？」
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "Where is the unsurpassed honored one to whom I don't give refuge?"

source_sentence: 迦葉報言：「今我師世尊，滅度未久。」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, "Now, my teacher, the Bhagavān, has been extinct for a while."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「世尊若在，不避遠近，其當親見，歸依禮拜。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, "If the Bhagavān were here, he wouldn't shy away from those near and far who would personally see him, venerate him, and rely on him.

source_sentence: 今聞迦葉言：『如來滅度！』
translation: Now, I've heard Kāśyapa say, 'The Tathāgata has ceased to exist!'

source_sentence: 今即歸依滅度如來及法、眾僧。
translation: "Now, I'll take refuge in the Tathāgata of Nirvana, the Dharma, and the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 迦葉！
translation: Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 聽我於正法中為優婆塞！
translation: Listen to me as an upāsaka in the midst of the true teaching!

source_sentence: 自今已後，盡壽不殺、不盜、不婬、不欺、不飲酒，我今當為一切大施。」
translation: From now on, I will spend my whole life not killing, not stealing, not committing sexual misconduct, not deceiving, and not drinking alcohol, and I will now give generously to all of them."

source_sentence: 迦葉語言：「若汝宰殺眾生，撾打僮僕，而為會者，此非淨福。
translation: Kāśyapa said, "If you slaughter sentient beings and beat your servants to make an assembly, that's not pure merit.

source_sentence: 又如磽确薄地，多生荊棘，於中種植，必無所獲。
translation: It's like the thin ground that's sure to produce many thorns, in which nothing will be gained when you plant it.

source_sentence: 汝若宰殺眾生，撾打僮僕，而為大會，施邪見眾，此非淨福。
translation: If you slaughter sentient beings, beat up servants in a lobby, and give to a large assembly of people with wrong views, this is not a pure merit.

source_sentence: 若汝大施，不害眾生，不以杖楚加於僮僕，歡喜設會，施清淨眾，則獲大福。
translation: If you make a great gift, don't harm sentient beings, don't inflict a rod or stick on a servant, and joyfully set up a meeting to give to a pure multitude, you'll obtain great merit.

source_sentence: 猶如良田，隨時種植，必獲果實」。
translation: It's like a fertile field that's planted at regular intervals and will surely bear fruit."

source_sentence: 「迦葉！
translation: "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 自今已後，常淨施眾僧，不令斷絕。」
translation: From now on, always give pure alms to the saṃgha, so that they won't be cut off."

source_sentence: 時，有一年少梵志，名曰摩頭在弊宿後立，弊宿顧語曰：「吾欲設一切大施，汝當為我經營處分。」
translation: Then, a young priest named Madhu was standing behind Vṛji, and Vṛji looked at him and said, "I want to make all great gifts, so you must manage their distribution for me."

source_sentence: 時，年少梵志聞弊宿語已，即為經營，為大施已，而作是言：「願使弊宿今世、後世不獲福報。」
translation: After hearing what he said, the young priest managed to give a great gift and said, "May it prevent the priest from reaping the rewards of good fortune in this world or the next."

source_sentence: 時，弊宿聞彼梵志經營施已，有如是言：「願使弊宿今世、後世不獲果報。」
translation: After hearing about that priest's charitable offerings, the misfit said, "May the misfit not obtain the results of his actions in this or the next life."

source_sentence: 即命梵志而告之曰：「汝當有是言耶？」
translation: He instructed the priest to tell him, "Would you say that?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「如是！
translation: They replied, "So it is!

source_sentence: 實有是言。
translation: That's really what they say.

source_sentence: 所以然者？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 今所設食，麤澁弊惡，以此施僧，若以示王，王尚不能以手暫向，况當食之？
translation: The food offered here is coarse and harsh, and if this were offered to the saṃgha, the king wouldn't be able to offer it to them with his hand for a moment, so how could he eat it?

source_sentence: 現在所設，不可喜樂，何由後世得淨果報？
translation: How can there be pure rewards in the afterlife when what is posited in the present is not to be enjoyed?

source_sentence: 王施僧衣純以麻布，若以示王，王尚不能以足暫向，况能自著？
translation: The king gave the saṃgha robes made of pure linen, and if he had shown them to the king, he wouldn't have been able to put his feet up and face them, so how could he have put them on himself?

source_sentence: 現在所施，不可喜樂，何由後世得淨果報？」
translation: How can there be pure rewards in the afterlife when what is given in the present is not pleasing?"

source_sentence: 時，婆羅門又告梵志：「自今已後，汝以我所食、我所著衣以施眾僧。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then addressed the priest, "From now on, you must give the monks the food I eat and the clothes I wear."

source_sentence: 時，梵志即承教旨，以王所食、王所著衣供養眾僧。
translation: The priest then complied with the teaching and offered the food that the king had eaten and the robes that the king had worn to the monks.

source_sentence: 時，婆羅門設此淨施，身壞命終，生一下劣天中，梵志經營會者，身壞命終，生忉利天。
translation: When the brāhmaṇa made this pure offering, he was born among the lesser gods when his body broke up and his life ended, and the priest who went through the ritual was born in the Heaven of Thirty-three when his body broke up and his life ended.

source_sentence: 爾時，弊宿婆羅門、年少梵志及斯婆醯婆羅門、居士等，聞童女迦葉所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: At the time, the elder Brāhmaṇa, the young priest, the svāhī Brāhmaṇa, and the householders who heard what the young woman Kāśyapa taught rejoiced and approved.

source_sentence: 佛說長阿含經卷第七
